Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2012 09:01PM blackcat2012 wrote: I am starting to get worried as I am 46 years old and have a maternal grandmother and maternal aunt who had breast cancer and I found my lump in August during my menstrual cycle and looked on the internet and the information I read said it could have been due to the hormonal change and to wait 7 to 9 days after my cycle had ended so I did.  On the 9th day I called the doctor and got an appt the next day, well I went in and the doctor told me she wanted a diagnostic mammogram with possible ultrasound due to the size of the lump which she said was about 2cm.  I went and had the mammogram a week later and they did the ultrasound right after and the radiologist came in and told me the lump was now larger than 6cm.  I had a biopsy on the 13th and it showed atypical cells/noninvasive.  I was called by my doctor and told that they want me to see a surgical oncologist for a consultation and another biopsy as they were not able to get a definitive answer on the whole mass as it is 7cm x 4cm x 3cm.

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2013 10:39AM blackcat2012 wrote: I am sorry you have to visit with us. Hopefully all will come out clear and fine for you and it is best to get a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound as Microcalcifications can hide cancer it also puts you into a higher risk catagory.  Try not to think about it and don't panic until you have to and it is best to catch it early. I am sure there will be others along shortly to offer more experienced advice.  Good Luck!!

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2012 12:10AM - edited Nov 4, 2012 12:13AM by blackcat2012 I went into a national store that advertises that they have prosthetics, bra's, camisole's etc for women that have or will be undergoing surgery for a lumpectomy or mastectomy.  I caught one of the sale's associates and asked her where the section was and she told me that they do not have a section but that the woman that manages that area could help me as she is surgically (mastectomy) certified.  I told her that I was looking for a post-surgical camisole so she went clear across the store and into some hole in the wall and came back with 1 post-surgical camisole and told me that after I have surgery that I would need to call and schedule an appointment as they do any type of fittings/showing the special bra's by appointment only.  To me that is just plain weird, but as they are very expensive they want to make sure you get the correct size, help, instructions, etc... I totally agree with you!!!  It is just weird!  Maybe they only show you certain ones as per your insurance?? Or if it is because you are new at wearing them??  I would call them back and ask to speak to the manager and find out why, just out of curiosity..

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2013 07:33AM blackcat2012 wrote: I am 5 days out from rads and having a lot of skin peeling, not painful. My ro recommended radiaguard and miaderm during and after treatment. They also recommended aloe vera so I went to Walgreen's and found their brand which contains aloe, lidocaine and menthol which is very soothing and cool (after refrigeration).
